bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 163, Number 8 (Thursday, January 12, 2017)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. LABRADOR:H.R. 503.Congress has the power to enactthis legislation pursuantto the following:Clause 9 of Section 8 of Article I of the Constitution--TheCongress shall havethe Power to constitute Tribunals inferiorto the supreme Court.[Page H473]

item.text:
Responding to Idaho's Judicial Emergency Act of 2017

This bill requires the President to appoint, with the advice and consent of the Senate, one additional district judge for the district of Idaho.
item.name: Introduced in House

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Courts, Intellectual Property, and the Internet.

item.latestTitle: To authorize an additional district judgeship for the district of Idaho.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

item.latestTitle: A bill to authorize an additional district judgeship for the district of Idaho.

item.title: Responding to Idaho's Judicial Emergency Act of 2017
To amend title 28, United States Code, to provide for an additional judge for the district of Idaho, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
